Principal: Amount of money borrowed

Capitalized interest: Unpaid interest that gets added to your student loan balance after periods when you donâ€™t make payments. After being capitalized, you must then pay interest on the capitalized interest.

Subsidized loans: Federal loans that do not accrue interest while you are in school. Interest begins accruing only after a six month grace period following graduation.

Unsubsidized loans: Federal loans that accrue interest while you are still in school. Interest will only be capitalized after a six month grace period following graduation.
